tut-oview.paragraph: In this topic you will learn how to use the XML-RPC interface for connecting non-Maji applications to applications developed in the Maji framework.

tut-section.paragraph: The Maji RPC API provides a way for non-Maji applications to interact with a Maji system. Currently a Java API is provided, but in the future C++, Javascript, PHP and other languages may be supported.
The non-Maji application interacts with Facets in Maji via bindings. These bindings then communicate over XML-RPC as the following diagram illustrates.

tut-section.section-heading: How to Use XML-RPC with Maji
tut-section.section-subheading: Creating and Configuring a Maji RPC Server
tut-section.paragraph: In order for RPC clients to connect to a Maji system, a Maji RPC Server Meem must be created. This Meem starts a server that the clients connect to and interact with.

To create a MajiRPCServerMeem,
Start Intermajik and create a worksheet in a suitable Category
In the Meem Toolkit, navigate to gateway | rpc
Drag MajiRPCServer onto your worksheet
Configure the Server using the settings in the following table.
Property Description
port The IP port for the Server to listen on
useSSL Whether SSL should be used. You should use SSL to prevent your information from being viewed by unauthorised users on the network.
sslKeystore The path to the keystore which contains the certificate for the server. This is used when the useSSL property is set to true. The key used is stored under the "jetty" alias
sslPassword The password to use for accessing the keystore
sslKeyPassword The password required for accessing the key for "jetty"
needClientAuth Whether client are required to authenticate themselves with a certificate.

A binding is required for each Facet that the client application is to interact with. Bindings are either inbound or outbound. Inbound bindings receive messages from the outbound Facets of Meems on the Maji Server, while outbound bindings send messages to the inbound Facets of Meems on a Maji Server.

Programs can listen to the MajiRPCClient for the status of the Facets that are bound. This will enable you to find out whether the Meem has been located and resolved and what the lifecycle state of the Meem is.

The MajiRPCClient implements the FacetHealthEventSender interface.
This means that you may create an object that implements FacetHealthListener and tell MajiRPCClient to send events to it by calling MajiRPCClient.addFacetHealthListener(FacetHealthListener listener)
To remove the listener, call MajiRPCClient.removeFacetHealthListener(FacetHealthListener listener)

MajiRPCClient will send FacetHealthEvents for each Facet. These events can be used to determine the following states of a binding:
RPC disconnected
Meem not resolved
Meem resolved
Facet resolved
It is intended that Lifecycle state will also be delivered via the FacetHealthListener interface.

Outbound bindings are required to translate parameters of method calls in the Facet interface to types that can be sent via XML-RPC. The types that can be sent over XML-RPC are shown in the following table.
XML-RPC data type Corresponding Java type
i4 or int java.lang.Integer
boolean java.lang.Boolean
string java.lang.String
double java.lang.Double
dateTime.iso8601 java.util.Date
struct java.util.Hashtable
array java.util.Vector
base64 byte[]

The binding registry is used by the Maji Server to locate bindings for particular Facet classes. A developer may register new Bindings with the BindingFactory. The new bindings may be registered by entering in META-INF/registryFile.mrpc:

codebox.pre:
// register default outbound bindings Outbound org.openmaji.common.Binary com.majitek.maji.rpc.binding.facet.OutboundBinary Outbound org.openmaji.common.Linear com.majitek.maji.rpc.binding.facet.OutboundLinear Outbound org.openmaji.common.LinearList com.majitek.maji.rpc.binding.facet.OutboundLinearList Outbound org.openmaji.common.Variable com.majitek.maji.rpc.binding.facet.OutboundVariable Outbound org.openmaji.common.VariableList com.majitek.maji.rpc.binding.facet.OutboundVariableList Outbound net.majitek.maji.system.space.CategoryClient com.majitek.maji.rpc.binding.facet.OutboundCategoryClient
// register default inbound bindings Inbound org.openmaji.common.Binary com.majitek.maji.rpc.binding.facet.InboundBinary Inbound org.openmaji.common.Linear com.majitek.maji.rpc.binding.facet.InboundLinear Inbound org.openmaji.common.LinearList com.majitek.maji.rpc.binding.facet.InboundLinearList Inbound org.openmaji.common.Variable com.majitek.maji.rpc.binding.facet.InboundVariable Inbound org.openmaji.common.VariableList com.majitek.maji.rpc.binding.facet.InboundVariableList Inbound net.majitek.maji.system.space.CategoryClient com.majitek.maji.rpc.binding.facet.InboundCategoryClient
